# 1. First, create your Quarto presentation (presentation.qmd)
---
title: "My Presentation"
format: revealjs
---

# Your content here
## Slide 1
Content for slide 1

## Slide 2
Content for slide 2

# 2. Render the presentation
# In terminal:
quarto render presentation.qmd

# 3. After rendering, you'll have an HTML file. There are several ways to embed it:

# Option 1: Using an iframe (in your website's HTML)
<iframe
  src="path/to/your/presentation.html"
  width="100%"
  height="600px"
  style="border: 1px solid #ddd;"
  allowfullscreen
></iframe>

# Option 2: If using a static site generator like Hugo, in your markdown:
{{< iframe src="/presentations/your-presentation.html" width="100%" height="600px" >}}

# Option 3: Embedding directly in your page (copy the rendered HTML)
# Add this to your webpage's <head>:
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/reveal.js@4.3.1/dist/reveal.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/reveal.js@4.3.1/dist/theme/white.css">
<script src="https://unpkg.com/reveal.js@4.3.1/dist/reveal.js"></script>

# Then include your presentation content and initialize RevealJS:
<div class="reveal">
  <div class="slides">
    <!-- Your slides content here -->
  </div>
</div>
<script>
  Reveal.initialize({});
</script>
